title: Schema for column description object
description: A column description is a JSON object that describes a single column. The description provides additional human-readable documentation for a column, as well as additional information that may be used to validate the cells within the column, create a user interface for data entry, or inform conversion into other formats.

name.description: An atomic property that gives a single canonical name for the column.

suppressOutput.description: A boolean atomic property. If true, suppresses any output that would be generated when converting cells in this column.

titles.description: A natural language property that provides possible alternative names for the column.

virtual.description: A boolean atomic property taking a single value which indicates whether the column is a virtual column not present in the original source.

@id.description: If included, @id is a link property that identifies the columns, as defined in [tabular-data-model], and potentially appearing across separate tables, described by this column description. It must not start with _:.

@type.description: If included, @type is an atomic property that must be set to "Column". Publishers may include this to provide additional information to JSON-LD based toolchains.
